Description: Rim and shoulder sherd of small Attic black-figured pottery dinos; interior and rim glazed black; exterior: black-figure animal procession to right (frontal head of panther, with added red on forehead, snout and neck; tail and back of boar with red on back above shoulder and dabs on flank); incised spoked rosette as filling ornament.
Bibliographic references: Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 256, no. 10)
Beazley 1944 / Groups of Early Attic Black Figure (p. 43, no. 1)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 292, no. B 275)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 147, note 43/7)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 227, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0259) (Phase 1)
